dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4225 EH: SAVE Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide a penalty for knowingly selling advertising that offers certain commercial sex acts.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Advertising Victims of Exploitation Act of 2014 or the SAVE Act of 2014.

section.header: Advertising that offers certain commercial sex acts

subsection.text: Section 1591 of title 18, United States Code, is amended in subsection (a)(1), by inserting after obtains, the following: advertises,.

Section 1591 of title 18, United States Code, is amended in subsection (a), by inserting after knowing, or the following: , except where, in an offense under paragraph (2), the act constituting the violation of paragraph (1) is advertising,.
Section 1591(b) of title 18, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking or obtained and inserting obtained, or advertised; and
in paragraph (2), by striking or obtained and inserting obtained, or advertised.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives May 20, 2014.
